articles.title: Reply Message to Kim Jong Un from Syrian President
articles.content:
Reply Message to Kim Jong Un from Syrian President
						
 Pyongyang, November 24 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK, received a reply message from Bashar Al-Assad, president of the Syrian Arab Republic, on Nov. 17.
					 The message expressed thanks to Kim Jong Un and the friendly government and people of the DPRK for sending kind congratulations on the occasion of the 44th anniversary of the corrective movement in Syria.
					
					 It wished Kim Jong Un good health and happiness at all times and the people of the DPRK greater progress and prosperity.
					
					 It expressed thanks to Kim Jong Un for supporting Syria and to the friendly people of the DPRK for extending solidarity to the Syrian people in their struggle for defending the sovereignty, peace and stability of the country.

articles.title: Special Envoy of Kim Jong Un Flies Back Home
articles.content:
Special Envoy of Kim Jong Un Flies Back Home
 Pyongyang, November 24 (KCNA) -- Choe Ryong Hae, member of the Presidium of the Political Bureau and secretary of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK), came back home on Monday by a special plane after wrapping up his visit to the Russian Federation as a special envoy of supreme leader Kim Jong Un.
					 Also returning home were Kim Kye Gwan, first vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, No Kwang Chol, vice-chief of the General Staff of the Korean People's Army, Ri Yong Chol, vice department director of the C.C., the WPK, Ri Kwang Gun, vice-minister of External Economic Relations, who are the special envoy's party and officials concerned.

articles.title: World Toilet Day Observed in DPRK
articles.content:
World Toilet Day Observed in DPRK
						
 Pyongyang, November 24 (KCNA) -- A seminar took place here on Monday on the occasion of World Toilet Day.
					 Present there were officials of the Ministry of Urban Management, Ministry of Public Health, Education Commission and other relevant units, staff members of the UNICEF and foreigners here.
					
					 Speeches were made there.
					
					 Speakers referred to the global sanitation crisis, the importance of the issue of improving toilets and scientific and technological measures.
					
					 The participants watched a science film on improving toilets in the countryside.

articles.title: DPRK Pays Effort to Protection of Cultural Heritages
articles.content:
DPRK Pays Effort to Protection of Cultural Heritages
						
 Pyongyang, November 24 (KCNA) -- A brisk drive is going on in the DPRK to protect the nation's cultural heritages.
					 In particular, South Hwanghae Province has taken the lead in this drive.
					
					Kim Chol Hyon, director of the Bureau for Protection and Management of Pleasure Park and Cultural Heritages on Mt. Kuwol of the South Hwanghae Provincial People's Committee, told KCNA:
					
					 True to the noble intention of the respected Marshal Kim Jong Un, officials and inhabitants of the province have turned out in the work to glorify the country with long history and brilliant culture.
					
					 Priority was given to well preserving the Mausoleum of Kogukwon, the 21st king of Koguryo (B.C. 277-A.D. 668), as befitting the leading relics representing the Eastern Culture in the 4th century. And we directed efforts to taking care of Mt. Kuwol, one of the famous mountains in Korea, and other scenic spots in the province.
					
					 We also pay attention to instilling the spirit of valuing the nation's cultural heritages into the schoolchildren and other inhabitants through visits to historical relics and scenic spots.
					
					 Kang Hui Yon, director of the Haeju Folklore Park Management Office, said:
					
					 Haeju City has a lot of spots of scenic beauty and historical interest. 
					
					 My office has worked hard to preserve in their original state Puyong Pavilion and other historical relics in the area of the folklore park, while taking measures to protect them from winter damage and planting many trees and turf around the park.

articles.title: Fodder Additives and Biopesticides Developed
articles.content:
Fodder Additives and Biopesticides Developed
 Pyongyang, November 24 (KCNA) -- New kinds of fodder additives and biopesticides were introduced at the recent presentation of sci-tech achievements in animal husbandry and veterinary work held here.
					 They include SDA (sodium diacetate acid) as a fodder additive and AVM (avermectin) as a biotic pesticide.
					
					 SDA is helpful to preventing fodders from getting decomposed while in store and improving their nutrition and taste. It is also efficacious for the treatment of various animal diseases.
					
					 AVM is recognized as an effective pesticide for its high ability of removing acari.
					
					 Those products are now winning popularity among users.

articles.title: KCNA Commentary Blasts Railroading of "Human Rights Resolution" through UN
articles.content:
KCNA Commentary Blasts Railroading of "Human Rights Resolution" through UN
 Pyongyang, November 24 (KCNA) -- The U.S. and the West are describing the railroading of the "human rights resolution" through the 3rd Committee of the 69th UN General Assembly as a "breakthrough".
					 We cannot but take issue with this row as it is part of political chicanery staged by the dishonest forces to make a dangerous precedent in the international arena by taking advantage of the U.S. hostile acts against the DPRK.
					
					 UN history does not know such a precedent as cooking up in great haste baseless "survey report" and adopting a "resolution" at its General Assembly with neither a dialogue with the country concerned nor a visit to it.
					
					 The hostile forces led by the U.S. are set to make a precedent of politicizing and internationalizing the human rights issue of an individual country and using it for toppling that country.
					
					 If such dangerous precedent is made in history, it is not hard to imagine what horrible misfortune and disaster it will bring to humankind.
					
					 "Human rights" were a pretext under which hegemonic forces caused disasters in Iraq and various other countries of the world in the past.
					
					 The imperialist forces are working hard to bring about regime changes in other countries under the pretext of "protection of human rights".  They instigate the reactionary forces in other countries to cause social chaos and discontent in a bid to set up regimes obedient to them. When those countries voice opposition to them, they put pressure upon the countries and imposed Western-style "democracy" and "human rights standard" upon them under the pretexts of "human rights abuse" and "retreat from democracy".
					
					 The U.S. put up the slogan of "protection of human rights" when it seized Grenada and murdered its prime minister after dispatching aggressor troops to it in the 1980s and did the same when it kidnapped the head of state of Panama after invading it.
					
					 The U.S. and the Western countries are persistently working to force other countries to accept its "human rights standard" by abusing the issue of universality of the human rights standard that is mentioned in the international human rights conventions as they did in the past.
					
					 Prompted by their unilateral interests that are quite irrelevant to the human rights, the U.S. and the Western countries are putting collective pressure on those countries that maintain their own social systems and political modes by branding them as "human rights abusers."
					
					 Due to the U.S. and other Western countries, the view that "human rights are above state sovereignty" is afloat in the international arena and interference in the internal affairs under the signboard of "protection of human rights" is being justified.
					
					 The U.S. and those forces kowtowing to it are trying to politicize the human rights issue while resorting to the application of selectivity and double-standards even though they are not qualified to talk about genuine human rights. If these acts are overlooked, such an act as taking issue with specified countries, prompted by political purposes, will rule the roost.
					
					 It is by no means fortuitous that analysts contend that the people of a country  have the greatest say about its human rights record and that the international community may show common concern for human rights through dialogue and cooperation but should never take such "confrontational" mode as the EU and Japan do.
					
					 Absolutely intolerable are the acts of the U.S. and the Western countries to make a dangerous precedent of speaking ill of human rights performance in other countries in the international arena for the mere reason that they are not their "allies" and "partners".

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Calls upon Scientists, Technicians and Educators to Become Present-day Chollima Riders
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Calls upon Scientists, Technicians and Educators to Become Present-day Chollima Riders
						
 Pyongyang, November 24 (KCNA) -- The position and role of science, technology and education have remarkably increased and scientists, technicians and educators have heavier yet more responsible duties than ever before at present when the building of a thriving socialist nation has entered a new historic phase, says Rodong Sinmun Monday in an editorial.
					 Talents, science and technology are the most essential factors of deciding on the national power of relevant countries and nations and their rise and fall in the age of knowledge-based economy, the editorial notes, and goes on:
					
					 Gone are the days when capital or natural resources played a decisive role in the state development.
					
					 At a time when confrontation in science and technology and scramble for winning over talents are becoming fierce to lead the age of knowledge-based economy in the world arena, the U.S. and other enemies are considering science and technology as main targets of their harsh hostile moves against the DPRK, aimed to obliterate it politically, isolate it economically and stifle it by force of arms.
					
					 The front of science and technology is the forefront for defending socialism whereas the educational field can be called a logistic base to steadily train talents needed for keeping a sustained initiative in the competition in national power, science and technology.
					
					 Science, technology and education at present are the two big pillars for achieving the prosperity of the country and nation and carving out their future and one organism inseparable from each other.
					
					 All scientists, technicians and educators should creditably discharge their roles as Chollima riders with their noble spirit and ample knowledge and thus make the world look up to the great Party and President Kim Il Sung's and leader Kim Jong Il's Korea.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Urges S. Korean Authorities to Abandon Bad Habit of Escalating Confrontation with Compatriots
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Urges S. Korean Authorities to Abandon Bad Habit of Escalating Confrontation with Compatriots 
						
 Pyongyang, November 24 (KCNA) -- The south Korean authorities should honestly reflect on their fickle and irresponsible actions with heavy remorse for the prevailing situation where they have scuppered the opportunity of improving the inter-Korea relations, says Rodong Sinmun Monday in an article.
					 It goes on:
					
					 This being a hard reality, the puppet authorities are working hard to pass the buck for the situation to the DPRK without any elementary reason and the slightest hesitation.
					
					 What they are doing now is unpardonable as they are blatantly challenging the DPRK's efforts to improve the inter-Korean relations after scuppering the above-said opportunity.
					
					 If they are concerned for mending the inter-Korean relations, they should pay heed to the DPRK's warnings and abandon their bad habit of pulling up fellow countrymen. The malignant mud-slinging and reckless confrontation prompted by extreme hostility towards fellow countrymen are the root cause of scuttling dialogue and contact and bringing the north-south relations to a catastrophe.
					
					 The inter-Korean relations can never improve unless the south Korean authorities decisively drop the bad habit of mud-slinging harmful to national reconciliation and the cause of the country's reunification. 
					
					 It is an elementary courtesy and morality to respect the dialogue partner and stop reckless mud-slinging now that the north and the south reached an agreement on dialogue and contact though they were antagonistic and hostile to each other in the past.
					
					 If the south Korean authorities are truly concerned for repairing the inter-Korean relations, they should abandon the bad habit and refrain from doing anything contrary to the atmosphere of dialogue as they promised to have a high-level contact with the north.
					
					 We would like to urge them once again to cool their heads overheated with hysteria of confrontation with fellow countrymen and to be careful about their tongue lashing and behave themselves, to begin with.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Slams Anti-DPRK "Human Rights" Farce Orchestrated by S. Korean Authorities
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Slams Anti-DPRK "Human Rights" Farce Orchestrated by S. Korean Authorities
						
 Pyongyang, November 24 (KCNA) -- The south Korean puppet forces are becoming vociferous, "hailing" the fabrication of the anti- DPRK "human rights resolution" and terming it "reflection of concern" and "positive cooperation."
					 Rodong Sinmun Monday says in a commentary in this regard: This glaringly shows that the puppet forces are a group of die-hard confrontation maniacs and disgusting servants of the U.S.
					
					 The recent "human rights resolution" fabricated by the U.S. and its followers is a criminal document aimed to hurt the dignity and social system in the DPRK and stifle it, and an open declaration of a war against it, the commentary says, and goes on:
					
					 The south Korean puppet authorities are the arch criminal who orchestrated the anti-DPRK "human rights" farce.
					
					 The ridiculous behavior of the puppet forces jumping for joy, "hailing" the adoption of the resolution, clearly proves that they are hordes of traitors bereft of any reason. 
					
					 They are seriously mistaken if they think they can impair the dignity and prestige of the DPRK and justify their moves for confrontation against reunification through such dastardly acts.
					
					 The eye-opening reality of the DPRK where people's ideals and dreams come true clearly shows the world people where the cradle of happiness is.
					
					 With no malignant mud-slinging can the puppet group do harm to the socialist land where the popular masses enjoy worthy life and happiness.
					
					 It is the fixed will of the army and people of the DPRK not to tolerate any accusation against its dignity and social system.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Urges S. Korean Authorities Not to Forget Lesson from Yonphyong Island Shelling
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Urges S. Korean Authorities Not to Forget Lesson from Yonphyong Island Shelling
						
 Pyongyang, November 24 (KCNA) -- The south Korean puppet warmongers who had been anguished due to the nightmare of the ignominious defeat on Yonphyong Island are now desperately working to recover from it, says Rodong Sinmun Monday in an article.
					 What matters is that the puppet warmongers' reckless confrontational racket on the five islands in the West Sea of Korea is pushing the north-south relations to an uncontrollable phase, the article says, and goes on:
					
					 When the largest-ever Hoguk war drills targeting the DPRK were under way across south Korea recently, the puppet authorities held such anti-DPRK confrontational farce every day as a "rally for vowing punishment for provocations" allegedly to recover from their bitter defeat on Yonphyong Island, the heavy setback they sustained for making a preemptive attack. The large-scale joint landing drill in the area around Phohang was a deliberate move to chill the atmosphere of north-south dialogue and provoke a war against the north.
					
					 The puppet forces who scuppered the hard-won atmosphere of improving the north-south relations are desperately kicking up the "human rights" racket against the DPRK in conspiracy with their U.S. master while getting frantic with military provocations in waters around the five islands in the West Sea. These are nothing but deliberate and premeditated scenario to escalate the tensions between the north and the south in a bid to provoke the second Yonphyong Island incident and develop it into an all-out war.
					
					 The puppet military gangsters' reckless act to repeat the Yonphyong Island incident is as foolish an act as digging their own graves.
					
					 Should the puppet forces unleash a war against the DPRK at any cost, oblivious of the lesson taught by the Yonphyong Island incident, they will perish in the flames kindled by themselves.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities Accused of Escalating "Human Rights" Racket against North
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities Accused of Escalating "Human Rights" Racket against North 
						
 Pyongyang, November 24 (KCNA) -- The National Reconciliation Council in a statement Monday accused the south Korean puppet group of its zealous involvement in the fabrication of the "human rights resolution".
					 After the anti-DPRK "human rights resolution" was railroaded through the recent 3rd Committee of the 69th UN General Assembly, the south Korean puppet forces are becoming more zealous in their "human rights" racket against the DPRK while "welcoming" the "resolution" and terming it a "reflection of concern of the international community".
					
					 The statement vehemently denounced the puppet forces' active involvement in the fabrication of the "human rights resolution" as a serious politically-motivated provocation and a traitorous act to push the north-south relations to the worst catastrophe.
					
					 The Park Geun Hye puppet group took the lead in cooking up the "human rights resolution," it said, and went on:
					
					 Such extra zeal shown by the group in fabricating the "resolution" pursuant to the U.S. was aimed to impair the high prestige and influence of the DPRK, justify its moves for confrontation with fellow countrymen in the north, put south Korean people's mindset under control and thus tide over its ruling crisis.
					
					 All facts prove that "confidence" and "dialogue" touted by the south Korean authorities are just hypocrisy and that they only watch for a chance to realize their ambition for invading the north.
					
					 The desperate efforts made by the puppet forces for the adoption of the "resolution" as stooges of the U.S. meant a declaration of a war against the DPRK as they were an indication of their total denial of its social system.
					
					 The south Korean puppet forces should stop running amuck, clearly aware of the catastrophic consequences to be entailed by their racket.

articles.title: Russian President on Boosting Russia-DPRK Relations
articles.content:
Russian President on Boosting Russia-DPRK Relations 
						
 Pyongyang, November 24 (KCNA) -- Vladimir Vladimirovich Putin, president of the Russian Federation, received credentials from Kim Hyong Jun, ambassador of the DPR of Korea to Russia, on Nov. 19. 
					 The Russian president said Russia has friendly relations with the DPRK which is its closest neighbor. 
					
					 Noting that boosting the political relations and trade and economic cooperation with the DPRK is doubtlessly in line with the interests of the peoples of the two countries and conducive to stability and security of the region, the president expressed belief that the Russia-DPRK friendship relations will grow stronger in the future.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's Work Off Press in Pakistan
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's Work Off Press in Pakistan
						
 Pyongyang, November 24 (KCNA) -- Marshal Kim Jong Un's work "Let Us Step Up the Building of a Thriving Country by Applying Kim Jong Il's Patriotism" was brought out in booklet by the Victorial Publishing House in Pakistan.
					 The work, published on July 26, Juche 101 (2012), deals with the essence of Kim Jong Il's patriotism and the noble career of leader Kim Jong Il dedicated to the country and its people.
					
					 It clarifies the important matters arising in applying Kim Jong Il's patriotism.
					
					 The releasing ceremony of the work took place at the publishing house on Nov. 18.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il to Be Remembered in Dominica
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il to Be Remembered in Dominica
 Pyongyang, November 24 (KCNA) -- A Dominican national committee for remembering leader Kim Jong Il was formed at the office building of the United Left Movement of Dominica on Nov. 17.
					 Jose Miguel Mejia, secretary general of the movement, was elected chairman of the committee.
					
					 The committee decided to give wide publicity to the revolutionary career and exploits of Kim Jong Il among the Dominican people by organizing significant events on the 3rd anniversary of his demise.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Remembered in Foreign Countries
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Remembered in Foreign Countries
						
 Pyongyang, November 24 (KCNA) -- Seminars were held in Austria and Germany and a round-table talks in Angola between Nov. 12 and 15 on the 3rd anniversary of demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					 Present at the events were personages of the Vienna, 21 County Committee of the Communist Party of Austria, the Solidarity Committee of Unionists for the Peaceful Reunification of Korea in Austria, the Anti-Imperialist Forum of Germany and a university in Angola and masses.
					
					 The chairman of the Solidarity Committee of Unionists for the Peaceful Reunification of Korea in Austria said: Kim Jong Il successfully carried forward the revolutionary cause of President Kim Il Sung and devoted his all to the well-being of the Korean people and national prosperity till the last moments of his life. He passed away on a train for field guidance.
					
					 The chairman of the Anti-Imperialist Forum of Germany said in a speech Kim Jong Il attached great importance to the development of science and technology, regarding it as the top priority issue, showed great loving care for the intellectuals and placed utmost trust in them.
					
					 His loving care for the intellectuals is being inherited by Marshal Kim Jong Un, the chairman noted.
					
					 A deputy president of a university of Angola praised Kim Jong Il as a great man who rendered considerable contributions to the prosperity of Korea and the global cause of independence with his extraordinary political caliber and noble personalities, adding that the exploits he performed before the times and people would be immortal.

articles.title: Brazilian Figure Denounces U.S. Moves to Create Political Instability in DPRK
articles.content:
Brazilian Figure Denounces U.S. Moves to Create Political Instability in DPRK 
						
 Pyongyang, November 24 (KCNA) -- Rosanita Campos, vice-president of the Party for Free Motherland of Brazil, carried an article titled "Intention of 'human rights' racket against socialist Korea, advocates of deceptive 'dialogue and peace'" on the Brazilian paper Hora do Povo on Nov. 15.
					 The DPR of Korea bitterly denounced the U.S. moves to create political instability in it by abusing international bodies including the UN Human Rights Council under the signboard of "human rights protection", the article said, and went on:
					
					 No matter how desperately media of world serving the U.S. may spread false report about the DPRK, they can't deny the reality of socialist Korea where the people receive dwelling houses free of charge from the state and enjoy free medical care and free education in the socialist system chosen by themselves. 
					
					 The U.S. secretary of State and other authorities are viciously trying to tarnish the political and moral image of the DPRK over the non-existent "human rights issue" and bring down its socialist system by letting loose reckless remarks to justify their moves to isolate and stifle it. 
					
					 In public the U.S. vociferates about "dialogue and peace" but behind the scene it frantically resorts to the aggressive war drills aggravating the situation on the Korean Peninsula. It does so to mislead the public opinion and thus cover up its true colors oriented to confrontation, not because it is interested in dialogue. 
					
					 If the international community truly hopes for peace in the Asia-Pacific region and reunification of Korea divided by outside forces, it should reject the war drills of the U.S. and south Korea, to begin with.

articles.title: Regresa desde Rusia el enviado especial de Kim Jong Un
articles.content:
Regresa desde Rusia el enviado especial de Kim Jong Un
Pyongyang, 24 de noviembre (ACNC) -- Choe Ryong Hae, miembro del Presidium del Buro Politico y secretario del Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, regreso el dia 24 a Pyongyang por avion especial tras realizar una visita a la Federacion Rusa en calidad de enviado especial del Mariscal Kim Jong Un.
					Vinieron tambien sus acompanantes: el primer viceministro de Relaciones Exteriores, Kim Kye Gwan, el subjefe del Estado Mayor General del Ejercito Popular de Corea, No Kwang Chol, el subjefe de departamento del Comite Central del PTC, Ri Yong Chol, el viceministro de Relaciones Economicas con el Extranjero, Ri Kwang Gun, y otros funcionarios.

articles.title: Portavoz del CRN advierte a la banda titere del Sur de Corea
articles.content:
Portavoz del CRN advierte a la banda titere del Sur de Corea
						
Pyongyang, 24 de noviembre (ACNC) -- En relacion con que la banda titere surcoreana tomo parte activa en la fabricacion de "resolucion de derechos humanos" anti-RPDC en la ONU, el portavoz del Consejo de Reconciliacion Nacional hizo publica el dia 24 una declaracion que sigue:
					Ahora los titeres surcoreanos aplauden la "resolucion de DDHH" anti-RPDC, fabricada por Estados Unidos y sus seguidores en el tercer comite del 69o periodo de sesiones de la Asamblea General de la ONU, describiendola como "reflejo de la preocupacion de la sociedad internacional". Por otra parte, estan recrudeciendo su campana de "DDHH" anti-RPDC.
					
					Tal comportamiento constituye una seria provocacion politica contra la RPDC y un crimen antinacional que lleva las relaciones intercoreanas a la peor fase de ruptura.
					
					Al frente de la fabricacion de la citada "resolucion" en la ONU, tambien estuvo la banda titere de Park Geun-hye instigada por EE.UU.
					
					Ella lo hizo con el siniestro objetivo de desvirtuar el alto prestigio y las influencias de la RPDC, justificar sus maniobras de confrontacion fratricida, calmar la opinion publica del Sur de Corea y salir de la crisis de gobernacion.
					
					Todos los hechos demuestran claramente que son hipocritas los alegatos de los titeres surcoreanos sobre la "confianza" y "dialogo" y ellos acechan la oportunidad de realizar su ambicion de agredir a la RPDC al cabo de su campana de enfrentamiento fratricida.
					
					La participacion activa de los titeres surcoreanos, lacayos de EE.UU., en la fabricacion de la "resolucion" anticoreana, constituye la negativa total al sistema y al regimen de la RPDC, por lo cual deviene una declaracion de guerra contra la RPDC.
					
					La banda titere surcoreana debe actuar con prudencia al darse cuenta de las nefastas consecuencias que emanaran de su campana de "DDHH" anti-RPDC.

articles.title: Tiene lugar seminario dedicado al dia mundial de instalaciones sanitarias 2014
articles.content:
Tiene lugar seminario dedicado al dia mundial de instalaciones sanitarias 2014
Pyongyang, 24 de noviembre (ACNC) -- Tuvo lugar el dia 24 en esta capital el seminario dedicado al dia mundial de instalaciones sanitarias 2014.
					En la ocasion participaron los funcionarios del Ministerio de Urbanismo, el Ministerio de Salud Publica, el Comite de Educacion y otras unidades vinculadas, los miembros de la representacion del Fondo de las Naciones Unidas para la Infancia (UNICEF) en Corea y los huespedes extranjeros que permanecen en la RPDC.
					
					En el seminario hubo intervenciones intituladas "Sobre el dia mundial de instalaciones sanitarias y la importancia de su mejoramiento" y "Sobre el diseno de instalaciones sanitarias rurales de formas mejoradas".
					
					Los oradores senalaron la historia de este dia y la crisis mundial de sanidad publica y subrayaron la importancia de los asuntos por la mejora de las instalaciones sanitarias que afectan hoy el medio ambiente, la educacion, la salud publica de la mujer y el nino y las medidas cientificas y tecnicas.
					
					Los participantes vieron un documental cientifico sobre la reestructuracion de instalaciones sanitarias rurales.
